author: chron.com
title: Radio Milano loses well-regarded chef
text:

Peter Clifton prepares a smoky cocktail called Earl & Isis at Radio Milano. Photo: Melissa Phillip, Staff Image 23 of 23 Radio Milano loses well-regarded chef 1 / 23 Back to Gallery Radio Milano , which ranked No. 17 on Alison Cook's Top 100 Houston restaurants list, announced this week that it is losing its well-regarded executive chef.
A spokesman for the restaurant offered this statement:
"After nearly a year and a half as executive chef, Jose Hernandez is leaving his post to focus on personal endeavors and family. At this time Hernandez has not announced what future projects he plans to pursue but Radio Milano wishes him profound success in his future ventures."
A native of Mexico City, Jose Hernandez was a French-trained chef who made the transition last year to cooking in an Italian kitchen. The transition appeared smooth. The restaurant, located in the posh Hotel Sorella at CityCentre, earned a three-star review from Cook .
Related Stories Alison Cook Top 100: 17. Radio Milano Review: Radio Milano's chef Jose Hernandez blossoms Hernandez was familiar with Houston foodies before opening Radio Milano. His previous work has included stints at Bistro Moderne, Aries, Gravitas, Philippe, Triniti, La Balance and Etoile.
